Package game

Class CoordinatePoints

java.lang.Object
game.CoordinatePoints
class CoordinatePoints
extends java.lang.Object
Simple implementation of CoordinatePoints class denoting a set of points on a 2d grid. The points are given in (x,y) form. It's main use is to store the coordinates of all currently alive cells in the game. It's naively implemented by two arrays of same length denoting rows and columns coordinates. It's running time is O(n^2) where n is the number of rows/columns (the game is on square 2d grid). However, given our limitations for row and column sizes we can effectively treat it as constant time (O(1)).

  • Constructor Details

    • CoordinatePoints

      CoordinatePoints​(int[] rows, int[] cols)
      A simple constructor of the CoordinatePoints class
      Parameters:
      rows - - x coordinates of the points to be inserted to the set
      cols - - y coordinates of the points to be inserted to the set

  • Method Details

    • getColor

      javafx.scene.paint.Color getColor​(int row, int col)
      The main method of the CoordinatePoints class, it's a simple utility to check if given point (row,col) is in set of points. It's running time is O(n^2) but with constant n we can treat it as O(1).
      Parameters:
      row - - x coordinate of the point we want to check
      col - - y coordinate of the point we want to check
      Returns:
      appropriate color from the Color class depending if point is in the set. Returns Color.Black if point is present in set, Color.White otherwise.
